intro: Odonteilema claussenii, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It features a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, cylindrical flower heads. Odonteilema claussenii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
